p: The GC-MS chromatograms revealed substantial variations among the six different varieties ( Figure 1). The GC-MS analysis revealed that the chemical compounds can be categorized under four classes ( Figure 2). The sesquiterpenes of the E variety were classified into sesquiterpene hydrocarbons (62.15%) and oxygenated sesquiterpenes (37.15%). Meanwhile, the ESEG variety attained 60.95% as sesquiterpene hydrocarbons and 26.11% as oxygenated sesquiterpenes ( Figure 2a).
